result.execSummary:
The defendant John F Radtke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Total fines and costs due by end of probationary period being served on case number 16CF0045 Failure to pay will result in one day jail for each $25 owed for contempt of court.

Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08
Concurrent with: conditional time being served on case 16CF0045
Defendant to submit a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John F Radtke

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant John F Radtke in court with attorney Brian Andrew Herro.  Defendant in custody. Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel submits plea questionnaire and waiver.  Court reviews the charges and potential penalties.  Court examines the defendant as to the waiver.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  Court accepts the plea, finding it free and voluntary.  Court finds the defendant guilty as to his plea.  Court renders judgment.
Atty. Herro contacted Court that he is not available for sentencing today due to illness. Case to be rescheduled for next week.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant John F Radtke in court with attorney Brian Andrew Herro.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Herro Herro requests plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
w/condition: absolute sobriety, no controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.

Defendant John F Radtke in court with attorney Brian Andrew Herro.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof. Plea of not guilty entered. Court orders $250 signature bond w/conditions.  Further proceedings scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

citations.chargeDescr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
